rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;3e4da97b.1503">   <title>Workshop on The use of Phylogenies in the Study of Macroevolution, Sep 28 Oct 2, Barcelona (Spain) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;3e4da97b.1503</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Registration is open for the course &quot;THE USE OF PHYLOGENIES IN THE STUDY OF MACROEVOLUTION -\ufffd\ufffd 3rd edition&quot;, Septiembre 28-October 2, 2015.\ufffd\ufffdInstructor: Dr. Juan L\ufffd\ufffdpez Cantalapiedra (Museo de Ciencias Naturales, CSIC, Spain).<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>New phylogenetic methods would allow us to draw on the information encapsulated in phylogenetic trees in order to address a wide range of questions on macroevolution. First, this course will introduce participants to the use, modification and representation of phylogenetic trees. Then, we will focus on the use of phylogenetic information to reconstruct ancestral characters and biogeographic histories, learning how to apply phylogenetic comparative [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T09:50:00+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>soledad.esteban</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;3e4da97b.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;1234ec16.1503">   <title>Rhino Resource Center - Newsletter 38 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;1234ec16.1503</link>   <description> NOW AVAILABLE \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd TO DOWNLOAD CLICK HERE<br>&lt;http://www.rhinoresourcecenter.com/index.php?s=1&amp;act=refs&amp;CODE=ref_detail&amp;id=1425084288&gt;<br><br>RHINO RESOURCE CENTER \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd NEWSLETTER 38 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd MARCH 2015<br>Edited by Dr Kees Rookmaaker<br><br>The total number of references in the database and collection of the RRC<br>now stands at 19,418. All about rhinos, their history, biology and<br>conservation. Many items can be viewed direct on the website. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T08:55:51+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kees Rookmaaker</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;1234ec16.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;c116629d.1502">   <title>SHNH Newsletter 108 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;c116629d.1502</link>   <description> I am now compiling the Spring issue of the SHNH newsletter.<br><br>Do let me have any news, comments, events or new publications of interest for inclusion.<br>Email: webmaster@shnh.org.uk<br><br>Many thanks<br>Elaine<br><br>Elaine Shaughnessy<br>SHNH Newsletter Editor   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-25T13:52:31+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Elaine Shaughnessy</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;c116629d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;4617bc5e.1502">   <title>symposium on Stubbs and anatomy </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;4617bc5e.1502</link>   <description> Dear all<br><br>There is a symposium on 9 March entitled 'Exotic Anatomies' at the National<br>Maritime Museum, Greenwich, London which focusses on George Stubbs and his<br>relationship with anatomy which may be of interest to some of you. There<br>will be sessions on Joseph and Sophia Banks and the Hunter brothers. Details<br>here<br><br>http://www.rmg.co.uk/researchers/conferences-and-seminars/exotic-anatomies<br><br>best wishes<br><br>Wendy Moore [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T09:22:55-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>wendy moore</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;4617bc5e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;84ae5661.1502">   <title>Journal back issues available </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;84ae5661.1502</link>   <description> I am running onto the problems of a zero growth personal library!<br>To try to create some more space on the shelves I have reluctantly decided to rely on the online copies of journals for back issues.<br><br>I have available for the cost of packing and delivery the following:<br>ISIS from June 1987<br>BJHS from 1991<br>Archives Hist Nat Hist from 1989. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T14:34:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Arthur Lucas</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;84ae5661.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item and<br>Architecture *<br>*John Nicholas Brown Center for Public Humanities and Cultural Heritage**Brown<br>University*   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T07:33:02-05:00</dc:date> rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;3f18ce33.1502">   <title>Reminder: Registration for '(Re)Imagining the Insect: Natures and Cultures of Invertebrates, 1700-1900' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;3f18ce33.1502</link>   <description> With apologies for cross-posting<br><br>From: Elisabeth Wallmann<br>Sent: 18 February 2015 16:28<br>Subject: Reminder: Registration for '(Re)Imagining the Insect: Natures and Cultures of Invertebrates, 1700-1900'<br><br>Dear Colleagues!<br><br>Registration for '(Re)Imagining the Insect: Natures and Cultures of Invertebrates, 1700-1900' to be held at the University of Warwick on the 7th of March 2015 is now open. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T07:45:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chaplin, Simon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;3f18ce33.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;bd5d90bc.1502">   <title>History of science/history of medicine Ph.D. opportunities at University of Glasgow </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;bd5d90bc.1502</link>   <description> &quot;Collections&quot;: 5 fully funded Ph.D.s at the University of Glasgow, including history of medicine and history of science projects in collaboration with the University Archives, Special Collections, and The Hunterian Museum and Art Gallery.<br><br>http://www.gla.ac.uk/colleges/arts/graduateschool/fundingopportunities/leverhulmetrustscholarships/<br><br>The Leverhulme Trust: &quot;Collections&quot; Scholarships<br>Collections: an Enlightenment Pedagogy for the 21st Century<br><br>It is well known that in the three hundred years since the Enlightenment, knowledge worldwide has made giant steps - but that at the same time, this knowledge has become compartmentalised. Increasingly narrow specialisms deliver insight and technological advances - at a price. Knowledge reflects depth, but rarely, a breadth of understanding. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T13:02:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chaplin, Simon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;bd5d90bc.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;1911ea7f.1502">   <title>Meeting on Digitising Natural History and Medical Manuscripts </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;1911ea7f.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>The Linnean Society of London will hold a day meeting entitled 'From Cabinet to Internet: Digitising Natural History and Medical Manuscripts' on 27/28 April 2015.<br><br>For more information and registration form, please go to http://www.linnean.org/Meetings-and-Events/Events/From+Cabinet+to+Internet<br><br>Organisers: Isabelle Charmantier and Andrea Deneau, The Linnean Society of London<br>Staffan M\ufffd\ufffdller-Wille, University of Exeter<br><br>Date: From 1pm Monday 27 April to 5pm Tuesday 28 April 2015 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T12:02:20+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Isabelle Charmantier</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;1911ea7f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;42ea7329.1502">   <title>Taylor & Francis - Free Access </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;42ea7329.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>Taylor &amp; Francis is delighted to offer you free access and open access options to the latest articles and research on Environment and Agriculture.<br>Please visit http://bit.ly/listservstandfeaoa to find out more and keep always up to date.   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T14:05:49+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gabriella Sciarrone</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;42ea7329.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;dde0b9fe.1502">   <title>Biogeography workshop, June 15-19, Barcelona, Spain </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;dde0b9fe.1502</link>   <description> Dear colleague,<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>There are still some places available for the course \ufffd\ufffd&quot;HISTORICAL BIOGEOGRAPHY: FUNDAMENTALS AND APPLICATIONS&quot;, June 15-19, 2015.<br>INSTRUCTORS: Dr.\ufffd\ufffdLone Aagesen\ufffd\ufffd(IBODA, CONICET, Argentina) and Dr. Claudia A. Szumik (Miguel Lillo Foundation, CONICET, Argentina).<br><br>PLACE:\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFacilities of the Centre of Restauraci\ufffd\ufffd i Interpretaci\ufffd\ufffd Paleontologica, Els Hostalets de Pierola,\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdBarcelona (Spain).<br><br>WEBPAGE AND REGISTRATION: http://www.transmittingscience.org/courses/biog/historic-biogeography/<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>PROGRAM:<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Topic 1.\ufffd\ufffdHistorical Background:<br>- The connection to cladistics. Basic concepts of cladistic methods. Optimality criteria in systematics and its connection to biogeography. How to manage space.<br>\ufffd\ufffd<br>Topic 2. Raw Data:<br>- Distribution maps. Errors in databases. Georeferencing and how to measure the error [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-03T10:41:35+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>soledad.esteban</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;dde0b9fe.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;cd9331fb.1501">   <title>BSHS Annual Conference, 2 - 5 July 2015, Swansea University: DEADLINE 31 JANUARY 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;cd9331fb.1501</link>   <description> PLEASE NOTE THE DEADLINE FOR ABSTRACTS FOR THE BSHS ANNUAL CONFERENCE IS: 31 JANUARY 2015 FURTHER DETAILS ARE GIVEN BELOW AND ON THE BSHS WEBSITE PLEASE CIRCULATE THIS RENEWED CALL WIDELY British Society for the History of Science Annual Conference 2015 2 - 5 July 2015, Swansea University The BSHS Annual Conference will take place from Thursday 2 to Sunday 5 July 2015 at Swansea University. The BSHS Conferences Committee now invites proposals for individual papers and for sessions from historians of science, technology and medicine, and from their colleagues in the wider scholarly community, on any theme, topic or [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-26T13:46:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chaplin, Simon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;cd9331fb.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;ad4fba2e.1501">   <title>FW: Conference announcement- "Refloating the Ark: connecting the public and scientists with natural history museums" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;ad4fba2e.1501</link>   <description> From: University Museums Group UK [mailto:UNIVERSITY-MUSEUMS-GROUP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Henry Mcghie<br>Sent: 09 January 2015 14:49<br>To: UNIVERSITY-MUSEUMS-GROUP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Conference announcement- &quot;Refloating the Ark: connecting the public and scientists with natural history museums&quot;<br><br>Hello- apologies for cross-posting, but I want to spread the word. Please forward this announcement on to anyone you think might be interested in attending. I hope to see you there. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-09T16:03:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chaplin, Simon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;ad4fba2e.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;eaa78632.1501">   <title>Durham: Visual Culture Studentships </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;eaa78632.1501</link>   <description> NB: If you are interested in researching the history of science and visual culture, please contact me and I can direct you to an appropriate department which might be interested in your project. I note that the deadline is 28 January 2015. Best Wishes, Matthew (m.d.eddy@durham.ac.uk&lt;mailto:m.d.eddy@durham.ac.uk&gt;)<br><br>Dear Colleagues,<br><br>We are delighted to tell you that the application process for the new interdisciplinary visual culture studentships at Durham is now open. The majority of these is funded by the generous award we have received from the Leverhulme Trust, supplemented by Durham University, which enables us to provide a funded internship of [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-06T20:01:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>EDDY M.D.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;eaa78632.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;46b29c88.1501">   <title>The Cabinet of Curiosities in Contemporary Art </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;46b29c88.1501</link>   <description> Curiosity 2.0<br>Die Wunderkammer in der zeitgen\ufffd\ufffdssischen Kunst<br>The Cabinet of Curiosities in Contemporary Art<br><br>16. &amp; 17. Januar 2015<br>Hochschule f\ufffd\ufffdr Bildende K\ufffd\ufffdnste Dresden<br>Aktsaal, Br\ufffd\ufffdhlsche Terrasse 1, 01067 Dresden<br><br>This conference Curiosity will seek an overview of current debates and of artistic and curatorial strategies. The contemporary version of the cabinet of curiosities is a machine for alternative world views, because inquiring minds and the thirst for knowledge cannot be tamed. What are the curiosities of the 21st century? Who are the freaks, what the monstrosities and where the mirabilia of the digital age? What are the politics, [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-06T18:27:11+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chaplin, Simon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;46b29c88.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;a1c53042.1412">   <title>FW: website for North West museums with natural history collections </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;a1c53042.1412</link>   <description> Thought this might be of interest to list members.<br><br>From: University Museums Group UK [mailto:UNIVERSITY-MUSEUMS-GROUP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Henry Mcghie<br>Sent: 18 December 2014 08:22<br>To: UNIVERSITY-MUSEUMS-GROUP-UK@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: website for North West museums with natural history collections<br><br>Hello- One of the things we've been working on in the North West is an online presence for our museums with natural history collections. This is part of a programme of activities to understand, celebrate and make good use of our collective natural history collections and displays. The website is aimed at people working in museums as well as anyone with an interest [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-18T08:28:16+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chaplin, Simon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;a1c53042.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;7f35443d.1412">   <title>Re: Linnean Society designated as a nationally significant collection </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;7f35443d.1412</link>   <description> Yes indeed.<br><br>David Elliott<br><br>From: History of Natural History [mailto:HIST-NAT-HIST@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On<br>Behalf Of Chaplin, Simon<br>Sent: Tuesday, December 16, 2014 11:31 AM<br>To: HIST-NAT-HIST@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: [HIST-NAT-HIST] Linnean Society designated as a nationally<br>significant collection<br><br>List members will probably wonder how anyone ever doubted the international,<br>let alone national, significance of the Linn Soc's collections, but it is a<br>pleasure to report that they have now been awarded official status as a<br>Designated Collection by Arts Council England. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-16T11:50:14-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>David Elliott</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;7f35443d.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;f704cf56.1412">   <title>Linnean Society designated as a nationally significant collection </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;f704cf56.1412</link>   <description> List members will probably wonder how anyone ever doubted the international, let alone national, significance of the Linn Soc's collections, but it is a pleasure to report that they have now been awarded official status as a Designated Collection by Arts Council England.<br><br>http://www.artscouncil.org.uk/news/arts-council-news/linnean-society-collection-recognised-its-national/<br><br>Congratulations to all at the Linn Soc!<br><br>Simon<br><br>Dr Simon Chaplin<br>Director of Culture &amp; Society<br>Wellcome Trust<br>215 Euston Road, London NW1 2BE<br>T: +44 (0) 207 611 7244<br>E: s.chaplin@wellcome.ac.uk&lt;mailto:s.chaplin@wellcome.ac.uk&gt;<br>http://orcid.org/0000-0002-2705-6480&lt;http://orcid.org/0000-0002-2705-6480?lang=en&gt;    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-16T16:31:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chaplin, Simon</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;f704cf56.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;c8e93db5.1412">   <title>Just published--The Syon Abbey Herbal: The Last Monastic Herbal in Britain c. AD 1517 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;c8e93db5.1412</link>   <description> [apologies for cross-posting] 12/7/2014<br><br>I saw a draft of this edition of an early 16th century monastic manuscript<br>herbal (and offered the editors some comments). The introduction and the<br>herbal itself are full of fascinating material for anyone interested in<br>herbals, natural history, late medieval manuscripts, history of libraries,<br>history of food, history of art, women's medicine, monastic life.... [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-08T16:07:46-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Karen Reeds</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;c8e93db5.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;ab2f772b.1412">   <title>Re: Botanical Latin </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;ab2f772b.1412</link>   <description> Thank you, Alan, I appreciate everyone taking time out of their busy days<br>to respond to my query. Natural history enthusiasts are special souls\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.<br><br>Eve<br><br>On Fri, Dec 5, 2014 at 1:11 PM, alanpp &lt;alanpp@bmi.net&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; Eve,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; I agree with Charlotte; Stearn's &quot;Botanical Latin&quot; is a sublime work<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Another excellent source is Brown's &quot;Composition of Scientific Words&quot;<br>&gt; published by the Smithsonian Institution, and reprinted at least as<br>&gt; recently as 1985.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; For bird Latin names Jim Jobling's works are excellent and may be in line<br>> with what you are interested in. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-05T16:54:21-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Eve Lippold</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;ab2f772b.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;cd081787.1412">   <title>Re: Botanical Latin </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;cd081787.1412</link>   <description> Eve,<br><br>I agree with Charlotte; Stearn's &quot;Botanical Latin&quot; is a<br>sublime work<br><br>Another excellent source is Brown's &quot;Composition of<br>Scientific Words&quot; published by the Smithsonian Institution, and<br>reprinted at least as recently as 1985.<br><br>For bird Latin names Jim<br>Jobling's works are excellent and may be in line with what you are<br>interested in. One example is &quot;A Dictionary of Scientific Bird Names&quot;,<br>Oxford Press. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-05T10:11:45-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>alanpp</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;cd081787.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;d8ab461c.1412">   <title>Botanical Latin </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;d8ab461c.1412</link>   <description> Hello, Eve -- It's not online, but well worth the purchase: Botanical<br>Latin, by William T. Stearn.<br><br>http://www.amazon.com/Botanical-Latin-William-T-Stearn/dp/0881926272/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&amp;ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1417798653&amp;sr=1-1&amp;keywords=botanical+latin+stearn<br><br>It's a trusted go-to source for deciphering plant names. -- Charlotte<br>Tancin<br><br>On Dec 4, 2014, at 8:27 AM, Eve Lippold&lt;evelippold@GMAIL.COM &lt;https://webmail.andrew.cmu.edu/src/compose.php?send_to=evelippold%40GMAIL.COM&gt;&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; Hello, Paul,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; I am a retired Animal Science instructor who taught at a vocational agriculture<br>high school. There was something I was always looking for and retired without<br>finding it-a site of some sort where I could tell my students to go, type in the<br>scientific name of the animal, and get the English translation; so [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-05T11:58:59-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charlotte Tancin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;d8ab461c.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;5bcef2be.1412">   <title>FW: Visions of Education and Beauty, Berlin 2-4 July 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;5bcef2be.1412</link>   <description> This call for papers may be of interest: apologies for any cross posting.<br>Gina Douglas<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: MGHG Discussion Forum [mailto:MGHG-LIST@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Elena Greer<br>Sent: 04 December 2014 12:00<br>To: MGHG-LIST@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: CFP: Visions of Education and Beauty, Berlin 2-4 July 2015<br><br>CFP: Visions of Education and Beauty (Berlin, 2-4 Jul 15)<br><br>Berlin, July 2 - 04, 2015<br>Deadline: Dec 31, 2014 [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-04T16:52:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gina Douglas</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;5bcef2be.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;5aa97aa2.1412">   <title>Re: Biodiversity Heritage Library </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;5aa97aa2.1412</link>   <description> I've never seen such a site but the nearest are perhaps<br><br>www.perseus.tufts.edu&lt;http://www.perseus.tufts.edu&gt; for classics dictionaries generally<br><br>and, if you can find it on the net, perhaps on Biodiversity Archive, the good old 'Dictionarium trilingue' by John Ray.<br><br>However,<br><br>1. There are significant transliteration issues in Greek and even Latin; for instance Rhomaleosaurus is from the Greek for strong + reptile/lizard. The root words are transliterated exactly as romaleos + sauros but one then needs to add accents, etc., to select the correct long/short e and o, and aspirate the r, for the first word alone, before one can find it [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-04T15:37:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Taylor</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;5aa97aa2.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;2f6d5e56.1412">   <title>Re: Biodiversity Heritage Library </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;2f6d5e56.1412</link>   <description> Hi Eve,<br><br>Well, if the animal is a fish, Fishbase.org does a great job.<br><br>Sara Scharf<br><br>sarascharf.com<br>Editing, research, knowledge translation and more!<br><br>On Dec 4, 2014, at 8:27 AM, Eve Lippold &lt;evelippold@GMAIL.COM&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; Hello, Paul,<br>&gt;<br>> I am a retired Animal Science instructor who taught at a vocational agriculture high school. There was something I was always looking for and retired without finding it-a site of some sort where I could tell my students to go, type in the scientific name of the animal, and get the English translation; so that if they put in "Pogona vitticeps", [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-04T10:49:21-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sara Scharf</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;2f6d5e56.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;f61890de.1412">   <title>Re: Biodiversity Heritage Library </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;f61890de.1412</link>   <description> Hello, Paul,<br><br>I am a retired Animal Science instructor who taught at a vocational<br>agriculture high school. There was something I was always looking for and<br>retired without finding it-a site of some sort where I could tell my<br>students to go, type in the scientific name of the animal, and get the<br>English translation; so that if they put in &quot;Pogona vitticeps&quot;, up would<br>pop &quot;banded beard&quot;. Some souce that would be quick and simple; just type<br>in the Latin (Greek, etc.) and get the English. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-04T08:27:45-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Eve Lippold</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;f61890de.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;60aa77c0.1412">   <title>Biodiversity Heritage Library </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;60aa77c0.1412</link>   <description> As a amateur naturalist I have found the The Biodiversity Heritage Library an invaluable resource for providing free open access to books and journals, scientific names, authors and subjects that were previously available in only a few select libraries in the developed world<br>The Biodiversity Heritage Library works collaboratively tomake biodiversity literature openly available to the world as part of a global biodiversitycommunity.<br>Regards<br>Paul<br>\ufffd\ufffdhttp://biodiversitylibrary.org/   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-03T23:39:38+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Paul Mead</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;60aa77c0.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;d493b9dc.1412">   <title>a sidebar on Karen's post </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;d493b9dc.1412</link>   <description> I just wanted to add something to Karen's post. I'm a historical discourse linguist, so a bit outside the disciplinary domain of most of you, but my field of research for the last thirty years has been the discourse of natural history from the 17th to the 19th century. When Karen mentioned the U. of Michigan Natural History Museum, I just thought I'd mention that some of the most interesting and inluential work in this area (though not from a historical perspective) has been done by John Swales, studying the correspondence and other forms of written and spoken discourse at [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-02T07:13:26+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ellen Valle</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;d493b9dc.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;d6d33e60.1412">   <title>support natural history collections -- Citizen Science crowdfunding initiative launched </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;d6d33e60.1412</link>   <description> Dear Austin: 12/1/2014<br><br>Thank you very much for launching this campaign and for giving me a<br>concrete way to respond to the troubling reports on Herbaria and NhColl<br>about the drastic loss of support for natural history collections and their<br>staffs. This seems an imaginative way to start demonstrating the value of<br>the collections to a much wider audience. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-01T17:43:33-05:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Karen Reeds</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HIST-NAT-HIST;d6d33e60.1412</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
